document_title: Ethmoid sinusitis: Causes, symptoms, location and prevention
subsection_content:
Acute ethmoid sinusitis often tends to occur with frontal or maxillary sinusitis. Symptoms commonly used to differentiate are pain between the eyes and frontal headache.
In addition to physical examination and clinical diagnosis, your doctor may prescribe the following tests:
1. Nasal endoscopy
Nasal endoscopy is a routine test in the diagnosis of ethmoid sinusitis although the sensitivity is not high.(2)
2. CT scan
CT scan is important in detecting inflammation of the ethmoid sinus.
